result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Roy L Boucher

records.addlTxt: Hearing on December 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:59 AM Defendant Roy L Boucher appeared by video.  Attorney Abigail Broze in court for Peter M Wolff, for Roy L Boucher.  Prosecuting attorney Melissa J. Zilavy in court for the State of Wisconsin. All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. 
There are no victims on this case. 

Defense states that the Defendant is in in-patient treatment until sometime in December, and requests a status date sometime in December. 

Court will grant request to set another FP. 
Defendant may appear by zoom for next hearing if still in treatment.
Hearing scheduled for December 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

addressed to: Roy L Boucher for hearing on October 28, 2022
Return to Sender, Not Deliverable as Addressed, Unable to Forward

1:38 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Nikole Kane. Defendant Roy L Boucher appeared by video.  Attorney Brandon Carlson in court for Attorney Peter M Wolff in court for Roy L Boucher. 
There are no victims on this case. 

Defense has discovery and a pre-trial offer, and requests a plea/sentencing date after the Defendant's treatment is completed in January 2023.
Court will allow the Defendant to appear by zoom for a plea/sentencing date and try to set the hearing earlier.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.

01:32 PM Defendant Roy L Boucher in court by zoom video, in custody from Oconto County Jail, with attorney Peter M Wolff.   Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Roy L Boucher appeared by video means with Attorney.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Bail remains as fixed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Hearing on February 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

10:07 AM Defendant Roy L Boucher appeared by Zoom, in custody from the Oconto County Jail.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
THE COURT ORDERS THE DEFENDANT TO APPEAR VIA ZOOM FROM THE OCONTO COUNTY JAIL FOR THE NEXT COURT DATE.  Hearing scheduled for February 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Detainer placed at: Oconto County Jail complaint and signature bond was faxed
Hearing on February 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

10:09 AM Defendant Roy L Boucher in court by zoom video, in custody at the Oconto County Jail.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant states he will be released on March 2, 2022 and wishes for his mail to go to his address and not the Oconto Co Jail.  Defendant states he does not have an attorney at this time but did fill out the paperwork for the Public Defenders Office and sent it last week.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing and will set this matter for a status of counsel date next week.  If the Public Defenders office finds the defendant eligible, they may appear by zoom for the next date.  Clerk's office to set up video appearance from Oconto County  Jail for the next date.  Hearing scheduled for February 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on February 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
